intro: Lastrea tablaziensis, commonly known as the Canary Island rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its succulent, evergreen leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, with thick leaves that store water and reduce transpiration. It typically grows on rocky slopes and coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
